com.github.besherman.lifx

Class LFXHSBKColor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.besherman.lifx.LFXHSBKColor

  • public class LFXHSBKColor
extends Object
    Color described by hue, saturation, brightness and kelvin. For saturated colors the kelvin temperature does not appear to matter.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int MAX_KELVIN 
      static int MIN_KELVIN 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LFXHSBKColor(Color color)
      Creates a new color with a kelvin of 6500 (to match D6500).
      LFXHSBKColor(Color color, int kelvin)
      Creates a new HSBK color from an RGB color and a kelvin value.
      LFXHSBKColor(float hue, float saturation, float brightness, int kelvin)
      Creates a new HSBK color.

    • Method Summary

      • LFXHSBKColor

        public LFXHSBKColor(Color color)
        Creates a new color with a kelvin of 6500 (to match D6500).

      • LFXHSBKColor

        public LFXHSBKColor(Color color,
            int kelvin)
        Creates a new HSBK color from an RGB color and a kelvin value.
        Parameters:
        color - an RGB color
        kelvin - the kelvin value in the range [0, 10000]

      • LFXHSBKColor

        public LFXHSBKColor(float hue,
            float saturation,
            float brightness,
            int kelvin)
        Creates a new HSBK color.
        Parameters:
        hue - hue in the range [0, 360]
        saturation - saturation in the range [0, 1]
        brightness - brightness in the range [0, 1]
        kelvin - kelvin in the range [0, 10000]
